Wasabi Wallet was down for 2 hours.  Cake Wallet for #Monero hasn’t been down ever since its launch! (Thanks to #xmr and it’s amazing dev team)

Wasabi had ~2,800 CoinJoins total in the past 5 months. Monero has ~6,000 transactions per day (~900,000 / 5mo, ~320x). While there are limitations when directly comparing these numbers, it shows that optional privacy systems on networks struggle to achieve adoption.

@dreaminers @NickSzabo4 @yougetaquote Yes they do, and I suggest checking out my Breaking Monero series to learn more about these limitations. By talking about them openly and honestly, we can make the protocol better and give people the privacy they deserve.  https://t.co/Mk2grmvEvH
Monero contributor "woodser" has been working behind the scenes on a specification for the Monero wallet and daemon interfaces. You can see his latest work here in this PDF:   https://t.co/ZMkcd78qv3

There's a huge UX difference (for most users) between the following:  - Use Monero - Use Zcash following an annoying guide - Use Bitcoin following a really complicated, practically impossible guide  We can't build decentralized systems and expect >10% of users to be experts.

People in adversarial scenarios will need to follow guides, no way around that currently. However, the expectation should be that any non-custodial wallet should be "good enough" for most people. Monero is the only asset I can confidently tell most people to use without worrying.
